pageContext.description: Leaf-shaped blade. Strong point very sharp, very slightly bent. Lateral loops low down on socket, not strictly opposed; outline rounded. Midrib tapering, rounded, then sharper towards point; hollow only to 59mm up socket. Edges sharp, jagged, and worn. Socket approx. circular. Thin metal, ragged at mouth.
pageContext.patina: Greenish patina, scraped off down to lustrous silvery-golden metal.
pageContext.surface: Somewhat pitted in places, generally fairly good
pageContext.other: Width: blade 37mm; socket diam. at mouth 21.5 x 21mm,Weight: just over 2 3/4 oz = 77.96 gms
pageContext.publications: LFC SA Trans. - To be published
pageContext.collection: For Shrewsbury Museum,Mrs. Foulker, Wheathill Farm, Nr. Wellington, Salop.
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Wroxeter,Wheathill Farm,Field NE of Ravenshaw's Gorse,Found in clay, turned up after deep ploughing, on surface.
pageContext.gridRef: G.R. 1" OS Popular (1947); No. 118: 581/3109,6" OS Shropshire 35 SW
